ramchandra_narkhede wrote:
> Gordan,
> 
> I'm using maven to compile the source. I'm using following commands.
> maven java:compile
> maven test
> Once this is done a jar file under target directory is created. Now
> how can we execute heritrix using this jar file.

Have you consulted the Heritrix Developer's Manual? Neither 
"java:compile" nor "test" are the proper maven targets for a full 
runnable distribution build.

Maven is used to build exactly the final distribution which is offered 
for douwnload, so when you have Maven working properly, you launch a 
maven-built Heritrix exactly the same as a prebuilt Heritrix.

(Note that the dev manual officially describes Heritrix 1.X, which is 
built with Maven 1.02. Still, it may be helpful in understanding things 
about Heritrix 2.X, which is built with Maven 2.)

> Actually I'm trying to customize heritrix to increase the number of
> connections, so that we can crawl the site at faster rate, but cant
> get anywhere. Any further assistance would be appreciated.

Are you certain the target site approves and can handle the kind of 
faster rate that requires changing the code?

Rapid crawling can harm sites and trigger webmaster countermeasures. 
Even without changing the code, you can configure Heritrix to use very 
small delays -- small enough to negatively impact many small sites. So 
be sure to be careful, to understand what impact you're having on sites, 
and to provide webmasters a way to contact you if you go down this path.

- Gordon @ IA
